member.name: T:o2g.IAnalytics
member.summary: The IAnalytics service allows to retrieve OmniPCX entreprise charging information and incidents. Using this service requires having a ANALYTICS license. This service requires an administrative login.
member.remarks: O2G uses SSH to get the information from an OmniPCX Enterprise node. So SSH must be enabled on the OmniPCX Enterprise node to use this service.

member.name: M:o2g.IAnalytics.GetIncidentsAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a list of incident from the specified OmniPCX Enterprise node.
member.param: An optional parameter to limit te query to the N latest incident.
member.returns: A list of that represents the incidents raised on the specified OmniPCX Enterprise node, or in case of error.

member.name: M:o2g.IAnalytics.GetChargingFilesAsync(System.Int32,o2g.Types.AnalyticsNS.TimeRange)
member.summary: Get the list of charging files on the specified node.
member.returns: The list of that represents the charging files.

member.name: M:o2g.IAnalytics.GetChargings(System.Int32,o2g.Types.AnalyticsNS.TimeRange,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Query the charging information for the specified node, using the specified options.
member.param: An optional filter used to return only the 'top N' tickets.
Optional filter, to include tickets with a 0 cost.
member.returns: A object that represents the result of the query or in case of error or if the specified filter does not return any result.

remarks.para: The request processes charging files on the OmniPCX Enterprise. The processing is limited to a maximum of 100 files for performance reason. If the range filter is too large and the number of file to process is greater than 100, the method fails and returns . In this case, a smaller range must be specified.

member.name: M:o2g.IAnalytics.GetChargings(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{o2g.Types.AnalyticsNS.ChargingFile},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Query the charging information for the specified node, using the specified options.
member.param: The list of file to process.
An optional filter used to return only the 'top N' tickets.
Optional filter, to include tickets with a 0 cost.
member.returns: A object that represents the result of the query or in case of error or if the specified filter does not return any result.

remarks.para: This method allows to better control the processign of the request by spefifying the ist of charging files to consider. The list size must be lower than 100. If the number of file to process is greater than 100, the method fails and returns .

member.name: T:o2g.ICallCenterRsi
member.summary:
ContactCenterRsi service provides the capabilities on a RSI (Routing Service Intelligence) point:
To make route selection.
To make digit collection.
To play voice guide or tone.
To play announcements (prompts and/or digits).
To be able to receive the RouteRequest from the OmniPCX Enterprise, the first action is subscribe to rsi events and the second action is to enable the RSI point.
Using this service requires having a CONTACTCENTER_RSI license.

member.name: T:o2g.ICommunicationLog
member.summary: The ICommunicationLog service allows a user to retrieve his last communication history records and to manage them. Using this service requires having a TELEPHONY_ADVANCED license.

remarks.para:
The call history records are built at O2G server level, thanks to its telephony call monitoring and therefore, the comlog database is built independently of the OmniPcx Enterprise internal comlog.
Acknowledgement/Unacknowledgement of an incoming missed call using O2G is NOT synchronized with the OmniPCX Enterprise.
The O2G communication log has a depth of 100 records maximum per user. When the limit is reached, oldest records are removed.

member.summary: Occurs when one or more unanswered comlog records have been acknowledged.

member.summary: Get the com records corresponding to the given criterias.
member.param: The filter describing the query criterias.
member.returns: A object that represents the results of this query in case of success; otherwise.

remarks.para: When used, the page parameter of type allows to query the communication log by page. The result contains the same parameters and the total number of records retrieved by the query.
When used, the filter parameter of type defines the search criteria for the query.

When optimized is used and set to the query returns the full identity of a participant only the first time it occurs, when the same participant appears in several records. When omitted this query returns the records with no optimization.
If the session has been opened for a user, the loginName parameter is ignored, but it is mandatory if the session has been opened by an administrator.

member.name: T:o2g.IDirectory
member.summary: The DirectoryService is used to search contacts in the OmniPCX Enterprise phone book.Using this service requires having a TELEPHONY_ADVANCED license.
member.para:
A directory search is a set of 2 or more sequential operations:
The first operation initiate the search with a set of criteria
The second and next operations retrieve results
member.remarks: Note: For each session (user or administrator), only 5 concurrent searches are authorized. An unused search context is freed after 1 minute.

member.name: M:o2g.IDirectory.SearchAsync(o2g.Types.DirectoryNS.Criteria,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Initiates a search for the specified user with the specified filter. The search will be limited to the specified number of results.
member.param: The maximum number of results. The range of supported values is [1 .. 100]
member.returns: true in case of success; false otherwise.
member.remark: If the session has been opened for a user, the loginName parameter is ignored, but it is mandatory if the session has been opened by an administrator.

member.name: M:o2g.IDirectory.CancelAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Cancel a search query for the specified user.
member.returns: true in case of success; false otherwise.
member.remark: If the session has been opened for a user, the loginName parameter is ignored, but it is mandatory if the session has been opened by an administrator.

member.name: M:o2g.IDirectory.GetResultsAsync(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the next available results for the current search. GetResultAsync is generally called in a loop and for each iteration:
If the status result code is Nokthe search is in progress but no result is available : it is recommended to wait before the next iteration (500ms for example)
If the status result code is OkResults are available and can be processed.
If the status result code is Finish or TimeOutThe search is ended, exit from the loop.
member.returns: A object in case of success; null otherwise.
member.remark: If the session has been opened for a user, the loginName parameter is ignored, but it is mandatory if the session has been opened by an administrator.

member.name: T:o2g.IPbxManagement
member.summary:
The IPbxManagement service allows an administrator to manage an OmniPcx Enterprise, that is to create/modify/delete any object or sub-object in the OmniPcx Enterprise object model. Using this service requires having a MANAGEMENT license.
WARNING: Using this service requires to have a good knowledge of the OmniPCX Enterprise object model.

remarks.para:
The service uses two kinds of resource: the object model resource and the object instance resource.
The object model resource The object model can be retrieved for the whole Pbx or for a particular object. It provides the detail of object attributes: whether the attribute is mandatory/optional in the object creation, what range of value is authorized, what are the possible enumeration value.
The object instance resources It is used to create, modify, retrieve or remove any instances of any object, giving the reference of this object. For the creation or the modification of an object, the body must be compliant with the object model.

The list of sub-objects which are returned by a get instance of an object corresponds to the relative path of the first instanciable objects in the hierarchy in order to be able by recursion to build the path to access to any object and sub-object.
When access to an object which is a sub-object, the full path must be given : {object1Name}/{object1Id}/{object2Name}/{object2Id}/..../{objectxName}/{objectxId}.
ex: pbxs/1/instances/System_Parameters/1/System_Parameters_2/1/Network_Parameters

member.remarks: Only Object Subscriber is concerned by this event.

member.name: T:o2g.IRouting
member.summary: The IRouting service allows a user to manage forward, overflow, Do Not Disturb and activation of his remote extension device (if any). Using this service requires having a TELEPHONY_ADVANCED license.

remarks.para: Forward: A forward can be activated on the voice mail or on any number as far as this number is authorized by the OmniPCX Enterprise numbering policy. Use one of the methods: or to activate a forward.

A can be associated to the forward:
ConditionDescription
ImmediateIncoming calls are immediately forwarded on the target.
BusyIncoming calls are forwarded on the target if the user is busy.
NoAnswerIncoming calls are forwarded on the target if the user does not answer the call.
BusyOrNoAnswerOne of the two last conditions.
Overflow: An overflow can be activated on the voice mail or on the associated user (if any). Use one of the methods: or to activate an overflow.

A can be associated to the overflow:
ConditionDescription
BusyIncoming calls are redirected on the target if the user is busy.
NoAnswerIncoming calls are redirected on the target if the user does not answer the call.
BusyOrNoAnswerOne of the two last conditions.
Do Not Disturb: When the Do Not Disturb (DND) is activated, the user does not receive any call. The DND is activated using method .
Remote extension activation: When a remote extension is not activated, it does not ring on incoming call. Use the method to activate the remote extension.

member.name: E:o2g.IRouting.RoutingStateChanged

member.name: M:o2g.IRouting.ActivateRemoteExtensionAsync(System.String)
member.summary:
Activate the routing on the specified user's remote extension device.
When the remote extension is activated, it rings on incoming call on the user company phone. When it is deactivated, it never rings, but it can be used to place an outgoing call.

remarks.para: This method does nothing and return if the remote extension is already activated.
If the session has been opened for a user, the loginName parameter is ignored, but it is mandatory if the session has been opened by an administrator.

member.name: M:o2g.IRouting.RequestSnapshotAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Ask a snapshot event to receive an event notification.

remarks.para: The event will contain the dynamic forward, overflow, do not disturb an remote extension activation status. If a second request is asked since the previous one is still in progress, it has no effect.
If an administrator invokes RequestSnapshotAsync with loginName = null, the snapshot event request is done for all the users. The event processing can be long depending on the number of users.

member.name: T:o2g.IUsers
member.summary:
The IUsers service allows:
An administrator to retrieve the list of O2G users.
A user to get information on another user account.
A user to change its password or get some parameters like supported language.
IUsers service is available from a connected application, it doesn't require any specific license on the O2G server.

example.code: // Get the user service from an opened session IUsers usersService = myApplication.Users.

member.summary: UserCreated event is raised when user is deleted .
member.remarks: This event can only be receive by an administrator.

Allows to select only the ACD operators (agents or supervisors) during the query. This parameter is only valid for an administrator session.

member.name: T:o2g.Subscription
member.summary:
Subscription represents a subscription request used to subscribe events from the O2G Server.
The application builds a subscription using the object. This object provides a builder pattern that eases the creation of a subscription.
member.example:
To create a subscription, uses the methods provided by the Builder object.
Subscription subscription = Subscription.Builder .AddRoutingEvents() // Add routing service events .AddTelephonyEvents() // Add telephony service events .AddEventSummaryEvents() // Add event summary events .SetTimeout(10) // Set the chunk connection timeout .Build(); // Build the subscription

member.name: T:o2g.Subscription.EventFilter
member.summary: EventFilter represents a filter used to subscribe to O2G events.

member.name: M:o2g.Subscription.EventFilter.Add(System.String[],o2g.Events.EventPackage)
member.summary: Add the specified eventPackage to the subscription.
member.returns: The this event package has been added to.

member.name: M:o2g.Subscription.EventFilter.Add(o2g.Events.EventPackage)
member.summary: Add the specified eventPackage to the subscription.
member.returns: The this event package has been added to.

member.name: P:o2g.Subscription.Version
member.summary: Return the version of the events to subscribe to.
member.value: A value that represents the events version.
member.remarks: By default the event version is "1.0".

member.name: P:o2g.Subscription.Timeout
member.summary: Return the default lifetime of the event channel.
member.value: A value that represents the events channel lifetime in minute.

remarks.para: When chunk eventing is used, the server closes the connection in case of no activity after the timeout. In this case, the event channel is automatically re-established.

Allowed values are 2 minutes and 60 minutes, with an exception for the value 0. For this special case, the lifetime of the notification channel is not maintained by the given timeout, but depends on the lifetime of the user's session. A KeepAlive event is sent by the server to maintain the connection.

member.name: P:o2g.Subscription.Filter
member.summary: Return the filter associated to this subscription.
member.value: A object that represents the event filter for this subscription.

member.name: P:o2g.Subscription.Builder
member.summary: Return a subscription builder.
member.value: A object used to build a subscription.
member.remarks: The IBuilder object implements a builder pattern to easily build a subscription.

member.name: T:o2g.Types.CommunicationLogNR.ComRecordParticipant
member.summary: ComRecordParticipant represents a participant referenced in a com record.

remarks.para:
For a simple call (user A calls user B), the call record on each party will contain both the participant A and the participant B: (no guaranty on the order of the participants on 2 successive responses).
SideCom record content
On A side
Participant A (the owner of the record) with role=Caller and the answered status (whether the call has been answered or not)
Participant B : neither the role nor the state is provided
On B side
Participant A : neither the role nor the state is provided
Participant B (the owner of the record) with role=Callee and the answered status (whether the call has been answered or not)

For a re-routed call (user A calls user B, the call is re-routed on user C, caused by overflow, redirection or pickup), the record generated on each side including the user B side (the "victim" of the re-routing) will not contain as participant the user B itself because he was not the last destination of the call:
SideCom record content
On A side
Participant A : with role=Caller, the answered status, initialCalled=B
Participant C
On B side
Participant A : neither the role nor the state is provided
Participant C with role=Callee, the answered status (whether the call has been answered or not) and initialCalled=B which tells B that he was called by A but the call has been rerouted to C(with a reason) which answered or not to the call
On C side
Participant A : neither the role nor the state is provided
Participant C with role=Callee, the answered status (whether the call has been answered or not) and initialCalled=B

Furthermore, for a multi-parties call using addParticipant, the already connected users in the call will also received a call record which will contain the answered status of the added participant: this information is provided to distinguish the added participants which have really answered and the other which decline the call.

In the comlog notification events, the participant owner is identified only by its loginName (in order to reduce the event call flow), the other participants are identified with their full identity (loginName, phoneNumber).

In a result:
if no optimization is asked, all the participants are identified with their full identity.
If the optimized parameter is set to , only the first occurence of a participant (owner or other) is identified with its full identity. The following occurences are identified only with the phonenumber.

member.name: T:o2g.Types.EventSummaryNS.EventSummary
member.summary: EventSummary represents event counters associated to the user. It allows a user to get its new message indicators (missed call, voice mails, callback request, fax).

member.name: P:o2g.Types.EventSummaryNS.EventSummary.MissedCallsNb
member.summary: Return the number of missed calls.
member.value: A optional value that gives the number of missed calls.

remarks.para: If this attribute is not specified, it means that the server is not able to provide that information.

CAUTION: This attribute doesn't reflect the missed call number managed by the call server itself but is related to the unanswered and non acknowledged incoming calls in the history call. Therefore, either only the explicit acknowledgment of these history com records through the communication log API service, or a new answered call with the same user will decrease this counter. Moreover, the counter is incremented for each non answered incoming call, including successive attempts from the same caller.

member.name: T:o2g.Types.Host
member.summary:
This class represents an O2G host.
An O2G host can be reacheable from the local network, or from a wide area network. In this case, enterprise access can be secured by a reverse proxy border element.
An O2G host as a private address which is the IP address or the URI used to reach the O2G server on a local network, and a public address which is the IP address or the URI used to reach the O2G server through a reverse proxy.
member.remarks: It's possible to have only one address configured, but an exception will be throws if both are .

member.name: P:o2g.Types.Host.PublicAddress
member.summary: This property is the public address of this host.
member.value: The public IP address of URI, or if the public address is not defined.

member.name: T:o2g.Types.ManagementNS.PbxAttribute
member.summary:
PbxAttribute class represents an attribute in a .
A PbxAttribute can be of the following type:
Integer An Integer value is equivalent to an value.
Boolean A Boolean value is equivalent to an value.
Enumerated An enumerated value can have a limited set of possible values. PbxAttribute treats enumerated value as value.
OctetString, ByteString An OctetString or a ByteString are equivalent to a .
Sequence A Sequence is a structured data whose attribute member have a specific name and type: For exemple
Skill := Sequence { Skill_Nb := Integer, Skill_Level := Integer, Skill_Activate := Boolean }
Set A Set value is a list of attributes of the same type. It can be a list of simple value like:
SimpleSet := Set { Item := OctetString }
or a list of sequences:
SkillSet := Set { Item := Sequence { Skill_Nb := Integer, Skill_Level := Integer, Skill_Activate := Boolean } }

remarks.para: PbxAttribute provide conversion method to usual C# types. The conversion is controlled "at the best", but it can not check all the possible error case. An Enumerated value and an OctetString value can both be converted to a .
When a conversion error is detected, a exception is raised.

member.value: A value that represents the attribute name.

member.name: T:o2g.Types.PhoneSetProgrammableNS.Pin
member.summary: Pin class represents a PIN (Personal Identification Number)

remarks.para: This service allows the user to announce that the call he is making is a personal (external) call and not a business call. Using pulse metering tickets, the company is then able to invoice this call again as a personal call.
This service can be applied to local users (employees) or visitors (in this case, the created user set is a virtual set without a physical address).
To use this service, users must dial the personal prefix followed by the PIN No. and then the secret code followed by the external number.
The Personal Identification Number is private and secret; only the administrator and, in certain cases, the pulse metering administrator may know it.

Most of the O2G services return the following code in case of error:
CodeDescription

member.summary: Unknown routing error.

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorType.BadParameterValue
member.summary: The routing service has rejected the request for a bad or missing parameter reason.

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorType.Unauthorized
member.summary:
Routing service request has been rejected because of limitation configured on the concerned user. For examples:
Overflow on busy is not allowed (barring limitation).
Cancel overflow is not allowed: (barring limitation).
Phone number to other destination is not authorized (dial plan limitation).

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorType.InvalidOperation
member.summary: Requested operation is not supported by the routing service.

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorType.IncompletePhoneNumber
member.summary:
The provided phone number can not be fully resolved in the current dial plan. For example:
Setting route with a destination type Other, containing a partially matching number (e.g. 3253 instead of 32535).

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorType.UnknownPhoneNumber
member.summary:
The provided phone number can not be resolved in the current dial plan. For example:
Setting route with a destination type NUMBER, containing an unknown number.

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorCause.Unknown

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorCause.BadPhoneNumberFormat
member.summary:
The phone number does not comply with formating rules. For examples:
The phone number does not respect the following regular expression: [+]?[0-9A-D*#\\(\\) ]{1,49}.

member.summary:

The device is not in an acceptable state to be used.

member.summary:
The given forward route is not valid. For examples:
The forwarded destination type is not one of VOICEMAIL or NUMBER.
The forwarded destination is not acceptable.
A loop in the forward chain has been detected.

member.name: F:o2g.Types.RestErrorInfo.RoutingErrorInfo.RoutingErrorCause.InvalidOverflowRoute

member.name: T:o2g.Types.RoutingNS.RoutingState
member.summary:
RoutingState represente a user routing state.
A routing state is composed of four elements
Remote extension activationWhen the user is configured with a remote extension, he has the possibility to activate or deactivate this remote extension. when the remote extension is de-activated, call are not presented on the mobile device.
ForwardThe user can configure a forward, on his voice mail if any or on any other number (depending on the cOmniPCX Enterprise configuration).
OverflowThe user can configure an overflow on his asociate or on his voce mail. If a forward is configured, it is considered prio the overflow.
Do Not DisturbWhen Do Not Disturb (DND) is activated, call are not presented to the user.
